review_title: Worst company to work with DBS DAH2 [DO NOT JOIN]
pros:
Cool office space, other than that nothing.
Great support in times of COVID19.
cons:
No work life balance, will end being in soup between IND and SG leadership tussle which will result in more that 14~15 hrs of work on weekdays and deployments on weekends.

No support for any issue can be expected by manager, hands will be tied by SG leadership.

No proper way of explaining requirement, BA part of Fixed income domain related Project can't even speak proper English and if fail to understand that and implementation for that is missed, then manager or lead will put this mistake on.

Because of this toxic culture, wont find time to learn something new or experiment with latest tech, as there is no SDLC culture here.

If some development needs to be done, tech leads only care about by when it can be done. rather than discussing about design or best coding practices which can be used for the development, diminishing any aspirations of software development.

They compare themselves with Google, Apple, Netflix, Facebook etc... there "GANDALF" model, but failing miserably to bring single value from GANDALF mentioned companies.

review_title: Toxic company - Stay away at all costs
pros:
1. Benifits like leaves, cab facility.
2. Support during COVID like extra leaves for the employees.
cons:
1. Very Toxic work culture. This is the SIngapore working style. If you have never worked with Singapore companies before and always worked for US/Europe companies in your past, avoid DBS at all costs. You can't fit in well and will start looking outside within 4 months.
2. Pushing the employees to come back to office at any costs.
3. No proper Software Development life cycle. You as a developer is responsible for architecture, design, code, test and deploy. If you are hard worker, the entire work will be on you.
4. Business don't understand the technicals and they don't care about the time it takes to complete the tasks. They simply demand the developers to complete in fixed time and we are bound to complete without any other option.
5. Culture is broken. Most of us won't fit in.
6. People are leaving like crazy because of all these issues. Think thrice before joining.

review_title: Enter At you r own risk(If you dept. starts with I*GT)
job_title: Software Developer, Technical Analyst in Hyderābād
pros: Best Looking Office, Second to none. Their talent upgrade infrastructure is also standard
cons:
The work culture is exactly the one you see in YouTube channels and get scared to death. What I am mentioning below is not just a personal experience. I was the last person to exit from my team who had all faced similar situatons.

CoVid: To start off, these guys were the last to shut down offices when covid started! Despite the complaints and agitations. As a result, a heavy percentage of young workforce got trapped in PGs for a really long time. Their infrastructure was not prepared for WFH and productivity took a hit. And instead of relaxing the timelines, they made it worse! 9 hr. day turned to 15 hr. soon and then the immediate managers started showing their colors. I was literally asked to have paracetamol and work when I had covid.

Usual scene: There is insane amount of favourism and mafia type situation, starting from junior management itself. Talent is worshiped here too! But don't expect accelerated growth just because of that. You will just be a very talented mule. Don't expect good ratings and increments just because you did good job. One of my colleagues got bad rating just because she complaint about here manager. He was rude because she could not deliver as she was stuck in a PG without proper internet, food and water!!!

Technical Infrastructure : There is none! you'll get new or changed requirements 2 hrs. before the production deployment. There are no good software development practices followed.
